data.name: AdFreeConfirmation
data.value: You are enjoying the ad-free experience. Thank you!

data.name: InfoWasteDescription
data.value:
Waste is the additional material needed due to cutting and scrap.
Recommended values: • Tiles, panels: 5-10% • Laminate, boards: 10-15% • Patterned wallpaper: 15-20%
Plan for more waste in complex rooms (bay windows, niches).

data.name: InfoRapportDescription
data.value:
The pattern repeat is the distance after which the wallpaper pattern repeats itself.
Example: • Repeat 0 cm = no pattern (solid color) • Repeat 32 cm = pattern repeats every 32 cm
The larger the repeat, the more waste occurs, as the strips must be cut to match.

data.name: InfoVoltageDropDescription
data.value:
Voltage drop is the voltage loss in a cable due to its electrical resistance.
Maximum allowed (per VDE 0100): • Lighting: 3% • Outlets: 3% • Motors: 5%
If the limit is exceeded, a thicker cross-section must be chosen.

data.name: InfoCrossSectionDescription
data.value:
The cross-section indicates the thickness of the conductor in mm².
Typical values: • 1.5 mm²: Lighting (max. 16A) • 2.5 mm²: Outlets (max. 20A) • 4 mm²: Stove, water heater • 6 mm²: Heavy consumers
The longer the cable, the thicker the cross-section should be.

data.name: InfoCoverageDescription
data.value:
Coverage indicates how much area can be painted with 1 liter of paint.
Typical values: • Smooth wall paint: 6-8 m²/L • Textured wall paint: 4-6 m²/L • Emulsion paint: 7-10 m²/L • Latex paint: 5-7 m²/L
Coverage decreases on rough surfaces!
